result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard W Bauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education programming

--no acts or threats of violence

--to maintain absolute sobriety

--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling 

--to comply with DNA sample provision 

The Court reads in an uncharged referral (DA Case #22JE973) for Misdemeanor Bailjumping with a 4/29/22 date of violation, and thereafter the Court bars further prosecution of this referral.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard W Bauer

defendant.name: Bauer, Richard W
defendant.address: 109 S. Main St #10, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 1:52pm 
Defendant Richard W Bauer in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance. 
Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in an uncharged referral (DA Case #22JE973) for Misdemeanor Bailjumping with a 4/29/22 date of violation, and thereafter the Court bars further prosecution of this referral. 

The Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Bauer on Probation for 12 months, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling 
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education programming 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with co-actors Michele C Schacht or Anthony K Hill unless approved by the Agent 
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--to pay costs and DNA surcharge [Clerk calculates this total to be: $443] 

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
The Court requires Mr. Bauer to report to the Jefferson Probation Office by 3:00pm today. 
recess 2:06pm.

Pre-trial conference on June 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on June 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[MK] cases #22CM30, #22CM31, #22CM32 called at 8:41am
Co-Defendant Michele C Schacht in court with Attorney Andrew Griggs.
Co-Defendant Richard W Bauer in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.
Co-Defendant Anthony K Hill in court. His counsel, Attorney Francis Raff, appears by telephone.
ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance.  
Attorney Griggs and Attorney Huebner each make reference to their awareness of new charges; the scheduling of a pretrial conference is requested.  
recess 8:46am 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on June 8th at 3:00pm (Schacht), 1:00pm (Bauer) and 1:40pm (Hill),  (2) Status Conference on June 30th at 2:00pm

Pre-trial conference on March 23, 2022 at 11:40 am.
Status conference on May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ae] cases 22CM31 and 22CM32 called 10:50 AM Defendant Richard W Bauer in court with attorney Karl E Huebner. Defendant Anthony Keith Hill in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.


As to 22CM31: The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered; speedy trial waived 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no contact with co-defendants
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

As to 22CM32: The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered; speedy trial waived 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no contact with co-defendants
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess: 10:58 am
NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/23/22 at 11:40 am for 22CM31 and 3/23/22 at 1:40 for 22CM32    (2) Status Conference on 5/5/22 at 8:30 am
